001package gust.backend.driver.inmemory;
002
003import com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListeningScheduledExecutorService;
004import com.google.protobuf.Message;
005import gust.backend.model.*;
006
007import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
008import java.util.Optional;
009import java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService;
010
011
012/**
013 * Reference implementation of a {@link ModelAdapter}. Stores persisted models in a static concurrent hash map. It is
014 * not a good idea to use this in production, under any circumstances (especially because there is no persistence across
015 * restarts or between hosts).
016 *
017 * <p>This adapter can use any model codec, and any cache driver, in front of its storage operations. The backing map
018 * stores entities as opaque blobs, so it doesn't care how they are serialized or inflated. Queries are not supported by
019 * this engine.</p>
020 */
021@SuppressWarnings("UnstableApiUsage")
022public final class InMemoryAdapter<Key extends Message, Model extends Message>
023  implements ModelAdapter<Key, Model, EncodedModel> {
024  /** Specifies the format to use. One of `BINARY`, `JSON`, or `TEXT`. */
025  private static final EncodingMode FORMAT = EncodingMode.BINARY;
026
027  /** Driver for this in-memory adapter. */
028  private final @Nonnull InMemoryDriver<Key, Model> driver;
029
030  /** Codec in use for model serialization/de-serialization activities. */
031  private final @Nonnull ModelCodec<Model, EncodedModel> codec;
032
033  /** Cache to use for model interactions through this adapter (optional). */
034  private final @Nonnull Optional<CacheDriver<Key, Model>> cache;
035
036  /**
037   * Private constructor - create an in-memory adapter from scratch.
038   *
039   * @param keyInstance Empty instance of the attached model's key.
040   * @param codec Model codec to use with this adapter (when serializing/de-serializing instances).
041   * @param cache Caching driver to use with this adapter (optional).
042   * @param executorService Executor service to use for storage operations.
043   */
044  @SuppressWarnings("unused")
045  private InMemoryAdapter(@Nonnull Key keyInstance,
046                          @Nonnull ModelCodec<Model, EncodedModel> codec,
047                          @Nonnull Optional<CacheDriver<Key, Model>> cache,
048                          @Nonnull ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService) {
049    this.cache = cache;
050    this.codec = codec;
051    this.driver = InMemoryDriver.acquire(codec, executorService);
052  }
053
054  /**
055   * Acquire an instance of the {@link InMemoryAdapter}, specialized for the provided empty model instance.
056   *
057   * <p>An empty instance can easily be acquired for any given model, via {@link Message#getDefaultInstanceForType()}.
058   * The instance is used only for builder-spawning and type information. The provided {@link ExecutorService} is used
059   * for model codec activities and callback dispatch.</p>
060   *
061   * @param keyInstance Empty instance of the key type for <pre>instance</pre>.
062   * @param instance Empty model instance with which to spawn new builders, and resolve type information.
063   * @param executorService Executor to use for callbacks and model codec activities.
064   * @param <M> Type of model for which an {@link InMemoryAdapter} is being requested.
065   * @return Instance of an in-memory data adapter for the provided model.
066   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model is not meant to be used for storage.
067   */
068  public static @Nonnull <K extends Message, M extends Message> InMemoryAdapter<K, M> acquire(
069    @Nonnull K keyInstance,
070    @Nonnull M instance,
071    @Nonnull ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService) throws InvalidModelType {
072    return acquire(keyInstance, instance, Optional.empty(), executorService);
073  }
074
075  /**
076   * Acquire an instance of the {@link InMemoryAdapter}, specialized for the provided empty model instance, optionally
077   * specifying a {@link CacheDriver} to use.
078   *
079   * <p>An empty instance can easily be acquired for any given model, via {@link Message#getDefaultInstanceForType()}.
080   * The instance is used only for builder-spawning and type information. The provided {@link ExecutorService} is used
081   * for model codec activities and callback dispatch.</p>
082   *
083   * <p>If {@link Optional#empty()}</p> is passed as the {@code cache}, no caching will take place. If a valid
084   * {@link CacheDriver} instance is provided, it will be used only if {@code options} on a request allow for it
085   * (caching defaults to being active).</p>
086   *
087   * @param keyInstance Empty instance of the key type for <pre>instance</pre>.
088   * @param instance Empty model instance with which to spawn new builders, and resolve type information.
089   * @param cache Cache driver to use for read-path code in the adapter.
090   * @param executorService Executor to use for callbacks and model codec activities.
091   * @param <M> Type of model for which an {@link InMemoryAdapter} is being requested.
092   * @return Instance of an in-memory data adapter for the provided model.
093   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model is not meant to be used for storage.
094   */
095  public static @Nonnull <K extends Message, M extends Message> InMemoryAdapter<K, M> acquire(
096    @Nonnull K keyInstance,
097    @Nonnull M instance,
098    @Nonnull Optional<CacheDriver<K, M>> cache,
099    @Nonnull ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService) throws InvalidModelType {
100    return new InMemoryAdapter<>(
101      keyInstance,
102      ProtoModelCodec.forModel(instance, FORMAT),
103      cache,
104      executorService);
105  }
106
107  // -- Components -- //
108  /** {@inheritDoc} */
109  @Override
110  public @Nonnull ModelCodec<Model, EncodedModel> codec() {
111    return this.codec;
112  }
113
114  /** {@inheritDoc} */
115  @Override
116  public @Nonnull Optional<CacheDriver<Key, Model>> cache() {
117    return this.cache;
118  }
119
120  /** {@inheritDoc} */
121  @Override
122  public @Nonnull InMemoryDriver<Key, Model> engine() {
123    return this.driver;
124  }
125}
